result.execSummary:
The defendant Dashawn T Bonds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Straight time.
Credit for 3 days, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court continues expunction request to the next date for the restitution hearing.

AS OF 9/21/2015: Expunction was addressed: If Defendant successfully completes probation with no new criminal violations, Court finds that it is in the Defendant's interest to have this conviction expunged and that society will not be harmed by expunction.

No contact with Marshun M.
Attend Anger Management. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court will consider early termination of Probation in 9 months is successfully completed.

Restitution to be determined. Hearing set for 7/29/2015 at 10:30 AM.

AS OF 9/01/2015: A restitution hearing was held. Victim was not present. 
Restitution to be set at ZERO.

timeConds.notes: STAYED - Condition Time (nonworking hours) To be used at Agent's discretion as well as to the huber or straight time as well.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dashawn T Bonds

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC. Civil Judgment entered.

Defendant Dashawn T Bonds in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Expunction addressed. Restitution was previously set at zero. Defense presents statements as to expunction. State takes no position. Court grants expunction. Court finds that if the defendant successfully completes probation and has no new criminal law violations, Court will find that it is in the defendant's interest and society will not be harmed and grant expunction.
Hearing at 09-21-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Dashawn T Bonds in court with attorney Sam Benedict for attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Osborne said the victim is not present. Court orders restitution be set at zero. Court will set a separate date for expunction issue.  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Restitution hearing on September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Nicole M Masnica in court.   Defendant Dashawn T Bonds did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Both parties are requesting another date. State advises the victim was not notified. Court grants request.  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Restitution hearing on July 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.
filed by the State
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Dashawn T Bonds in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed. Reading waived.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty. Defense requests a restitution hearing. Court grants request. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 30 days jail straight time - credit for 3 days -  STAYED for 12 months Probation
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution hearing set
- Conditions of  Probation:  No contact with Marshun M.. Anger management.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  DNA, surcharge is waived. Court will permit early termination of Probation in 9 months if successfully completed. 
 -  10 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion. 

Defense requests expunction
State takes no position at this time with limited information
Court continues expunction request to the next date for restitution hearing  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on June 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Dashawn T Bonds in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a jury status/jury trial date. Court grants request. Standard form for motions, jury instructions and witnesses addressed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on May 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Dashawn T Bonds in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is investigating this matter and requests a date in 45 days. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on March 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing requested
Defendant Dashawn T Bonds in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant to have no contact with  co actor, victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Dashawn T Bonds in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
